CatDescriptText: Mr. James (Jimmie) Burnett, parking lot attendant, Homewood and Mr. William (Bill) Whitley, stock marker, East Liberty, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, March 11, 1961, pg. 7  with question: "Do you think Negroes over-emphasize "social life" as it pertains to entertainment?  If so, can you suggest a remedy for "curing it."  Mr. Burnett's answer reads: "I don't think so.  You never get enough entertainment, because of the need to relax. Nine times out of 10, Negroes work harder."  Mr. Whitley's answer reads: "I don't think Negroes overemphasize entertaining more than any other race does.  Everybody is entitled to a certain amount of pleasure."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of James "Jimmie" Burnett wearing dark cap, moustache, and dark overcoat, posed on sidewalk, Downtown; Portrait of William "Bill" Whitley wearing fedora and zippered jacket, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
